name: osqp

pre_pr_migrator_status.python39: not solvable: ['Encountered problems while solving.\nProblem: package numpy-1.19.1-py36h5510c5b_0 requires python >=3.6,<3.7.0a0, but none of the providers can be installed\n']

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set osqp_version = "0.6.2" %}
{% set qdldl_version = "0.1.5" %}

package:
  name: osqp
  # version: {{ osqp_version }}
  # upstream did not tag extra 0.6.2.post0; remove for next version!
  version: {{ osqp_version + ".post0" }}

source:
  - url: https://github.com/oxfordcontrol/osqp-python/archive/v{{ osqp_version }}.tar.gz
    fn: osqp-python-{{ osqp_version }}.tar.gz
    sha256: 7f8d4588f7173e2abb72570c27981168ae3142c8356af52a41e500695ee3d1bf
    patches:
    - patches/0001-setup-use-NMake-on-windows.patch
    - patches/0002-setup-do-not-use-different-output-folder-on-windows.patch
    - patches/0003-also-use-NMake-in-codegen.patch
    - patches/0004-Disable-MKL-Tests-on-nonx86.patch     # [not x86_64]
    # backport osqp/osqp-python#51 to break circular dependency with cvxpy;
    # while this contains basically only testing changes, it also bumps to 0.6.2.post0
    - patches/0005-Switch-from-CVXPY-ECOS-to-CVXOPT-as-a-test-dependenc.patch

  - url: https://github.com/oxfordcontrol/osqp/archive/v{{ osqp_version }}.tar.gz
    fn: osqp-{{ osqp_version }}.tar.gz
    sha256: d973c33c3164caa381ed7387375347a46f7522523350a4e51989479b9d3b59c7
    folder: osqp_sources
    patches:
     - patches/0001-reflect-new-mkl_rt-name.patch

  - url: https://github.com/oxfordcontrol/qdldl/archive/v{{ qdldl_version }}.tar.gz
    fn: qdldl-{{ qdldl_version }}.tar.gz
    sha256: 2868b0e61b7424174e9adef3cb87478329f8ab2075211ef28fe477f29e0e5c99
    folder: osqp_sources/lin_sys/direct/qdldl/qdldl_sources

build:
  number: 4
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps -vv

requirements:
  build:
    - python                                 # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - cross-python_{{ target_platform }}     # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - numpy                                  # [build_platform != target_platform]
    - {{ compiler('c') }}
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - cmake
    - make                           # [unix]
  host:
    - python
    - pip
    - numpy
  run:
    - python
    - {{ pin_compatible('numpy') }}
    - qdldl-python
    # source uses scipy.random, which got removed
    - scipy <1.9
    - vs2015_runtime                 # [win]
  run_constrained:
    # since paradiso directly depends on the SO name, which was changed then
    - mkl >=2022.0                   # [win]

test:
  imports:
    - osqp
    - osqp.codegen
    - osqppurepy
  requires:
    # some of the tests need mkl-specific solvers
    - blas=*=mkl                     # [x86_64]
    # codegen interface requires compiler + cmake
    - {{ compiler('c') }}
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - make                           # [unix]
    - cmake
    - cvxopt
    - pytest
    - setuptools
  # Disabled tests due to issues in QEMU, see https://github.com/scipy/scipy/issues/14560
  commands:                           # [not ppc64le]
    - python -m pytest --pyargs osqp  # [not ppc64le]

about:
  home: https://osqp.org/
  license: Apache-2.0
  license_family: Apache
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: 'Python interface for OSQP, the Operator Splitting QP Solver'
  description: |
    Python interface for OSQP, the Operator Splitting QP Solver.

    To use the `codegen` interface, install `cmake` and an appropriate
    compiler version. (We don't install this by default.)
  doc_url: https://osqp.org/
  dev_url: http://github.com/oxfordcontrol/osqp-python

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - djsutherland
    - h-vetinari
    - bstellato
    - gbanjac
    - jayfurmanek
